revised_title: On the Influence of Residual Gas on Repulsion Resulting from Radiation
tldr: The author investigates the repulsion resulting from radiation and finds that residual gas plays a significant role in the phenomenon. The experiments conducted show that the force increases as the vacuum becomes more absolute, suggesting that the repulsion is indirectly caused by a difference in thermometric heat between the black and white surfaces of the moving body and may be due to a secondary action on the residual gas.
